Indications and doses

Staphylococcal skin infection,

By mouth using tablets

  • For adults
    Apply 3–4 times a day.
  • For adults
    250 mg every 12 hours for 5-10 days.
  • For children
    Apply 3–4 times a day usually for 7 days.
  • For children 12–17 years
    250 mg every 12 hours for 5-10 days.

Staphylococcal eye infections,

To the eye

  • For adults
    Apply twice daily.
  • For children
    Apply twice daily.

Penicillin-resistant staphylococcal infection including osteomyelitis, Staphylococcal endocarditis in combination with other antibacterials,

By mouth using tablets

  • For adults
    750 mg 3 times a day.
  • For adults
    500 mg every 8 hours, increased to 1 g every 8 hours, increased dose can be used for severe infections.
  • For children 1–11 months
    15 mg/kg 3 times a day.
  • For children 1–4 years
    250 mg 3 times a day.
  • For children 5–11 years
    500 mg 3 times a day.
  • For children 12–17 years
    750 mg 3 times a day.
  • For children 12–17 years
    500 mg every 8 hours, increased to 1 g every 8 hours, increased dose can be used for severe infections.

Dose equivalence and conversion

Fusidic acid is incompletely absorbed and doses recommended for suspension are proportionately higher than those for sodium fusidate tablets.

Drug action

Fusidic acid and its salts are narrow-spectrum antibiotics used for staphylococcal infections.

Advice when patient is pregnant

With oral use

Not known to be harmful; manufacturer advises use only if potential benefit outweighs risk.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

With oral use

Impaired biliary excretion; possibly increased risk of hepatotoxicity; avoid or reduce dose.

With oral use in children

Elimination may be reduced in hepatic impairment or biliary disease or biliary obstruction.

With oral use in adults

Elimination may be reduced in biliary disease or biliary obstruction.

Known side effects

Specific side effects

commonOrVeryCommon: abdominal pain, diarrhoea, dizziness, drowsiness, dyspepsia, nausea, vomiting,

uncommon: anorexia, headache, malaise, pruritus, rash,

rare: hypersensitivity reactions,

notKnown: acute renal failure (usually with jaundice), blood disorders, reversible jaundice especially after high dosage (withdraw therapy if persistent),

Cautions regarding administration

  • With topical use: avoid contact of cream or ointment with eyes
  • With topical use:

    To avoid the development of resistance, fusidic acid should not be used for longer than 10 days and local microbiology advice should be sought before using it in hospital.

Monitoring requirements

Patient parameters

With oral use

Monitor liver function with high doses or on prolonged therapy.

Unlicensed use

With topical use in children

Licensed for use in children (age range not specified by manufacturer).

Information regarding prescribing and dispensing

Flavours of oral liquid formulations may include banana and orange.

Profession specific information

Dental practitioners

With topical use

May be prescribed as Sodium Fusidate ointment.
